newsitem.title: USA: Cellex Biosciences gross margins up.
newsitem.headline: Cellex Biosciences gross margins up.

text.p: Cellex Biosciences Inc, which makes cell processing products for the health care and biotechnology markets, said its gross margins for the first six months of 1996 rose to 35 percent from 32 percent a year ago.

Earlier, it reported a net loss for the second quarter ended March 31 of $0.16 a share, compared with a loss of $0.14 a year ago. For the first six months, its loss was $0.40 a share, compared with a year-ago loss of $0.68.

"...(W)e are presently on target with plans necessary to achieve increased revenues and improved gross margins which will ultimately result in sustainable quarter-to-quarter profitability and positive cash flow," Richard Sakowicz, president, said in a statement.
Cellex said it had a working capital deficit of $2.9 million on March 31, which was an improvement from a deficit of $3.2 million at December 31.
Cellex said its backlog of open sales orders at March 31 was approximately $630,000, of which $476,000 related to its LSL Biolafitte operation.
